procedures: Step 1: An application of a tax clearance certificate will enable the taxpayer reduce on their tax burden since one is prompted to clear up any tax obligation in the course on the year to obtain the certificate.
Step 2: A Tax Clearance Certificate facilitates easy acquisition of work permits for persons looking forward to work in foreign countries.
Step 3: It also facilities re-export and import certain restricted goods such as tyres, sugar, etc.
Step 1: Cancellation of a Tax clearance certificate can be done on request by the client to their office of jurisdiction.
Step 2: Persons who have not operated for more than three year may not qualify for an annual tax clearance certificate.
Step 3: The tax clearance certificate will be addressed to the address provided by the client.
Step 4: When applying for a TCC, the addressees correct accounting date should be quoted.
Step 1: The registration profile of the tax payer should be up to date
Step 2: The tax payer should have submitted all the returns for the registered tax types
Step 3: For Non-Individuals, the associated persons (directors or partners) MUST have submitted all their returns
Step 4: The submitted returns MUST be satisfactory
Step 5: All taxes due to must have been paid by the tax payer or there is a Memorandum of Understanding to pay in installments

Who is required to use an Instant TIN? Only Individuals Registered with the NIRA (National Identification Registration Authority) and who have been issued a National Identification Number (NIN) Note: Individuals who do not have a National Identification Number (NIN) issued by NIRA will not access this service. They should therefore use other alternative methods, i.e., TIN registration for individuals and TIN registration for non-individuals, respectively.

Any person who is likely to transact in any tax related business with URA, shall be required to apply for a TIN. The TIN is therefore an administrative requirement and applies to all taxpayers, regardless of the tax transaction.

Who is required to use an Individual TIN Registration? Any person who is likely to transact in any tax related business with URA, shall be required to apply for a TIN. The TIN is therefore an administrative requirement and applies to all taxpayers, regardless of the tax transaction.
procedures: Step 1: To download your TIN certificate:
Step 2: Visit the URA portal and log in with your credentials.
Step 3: Under e-services, select Taxpayer Profile.
Step 4: Then click Print TIN Certificate. The certificate will be downloaded as a PDF.
Step 1: Visit the URA website and then go to e-services,
Step 2: Click instant TIN, Fill in the required fields and click submit.
Step 3: Alternatively, the applicant may visit any of the URA offices or One-stop stations located in any of the Municipalities or KCCA division offices
Step 1: Open the AskURA App on your phone.
Step 2: Enter in your Email or Phone number (the one you used to register for your TIN)
Step 3: Tap on select taxpayer type, choose either Individual or Non Individual.
Step 4: Tap Submit.
Step 5: The URA App will display your TIN registered details.
